title: Enhancing Scientific Problem-Solving Competencies through Interactions between Self-Regulated Learning and Calibration

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Scientific Knowledge and Problem-Solving Experience
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented program for students aspiring to careers in healthcare, law, or technology, integrating self-regulated learning strategies and calibration skills within scientific problem-solving processes.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically apply self-regulated learning strategies—goal setting, resource management, and self-monitoring—during complex scientific problem-solving.
Learners can measure their calibration ability (accuracy of confidence assessments) regarding their knowledge levels and derive improvement plans.
Learners can apply practical strategies to enhance their calibration level through feedback and self-monitoring in the self-regulated learning process.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
